               <div class="block solid-5 round-all">
                <p class="title">
                 They Don’t Know What They Don’t Know: An Argument for Community Education
                </p>
                <div class="content solid-1 round-all">
                 <div class="hero ft-left">
                  <img src="/uploadedImages/Images/Articles/ci_ccapp.jpg?n=4374" width="140"/>
                 </div>
                 <p>
                  <contentabstract>
                   It is impossible to overstate the negative impact that substance abuse has on individuals, families, and society. Addiction is arguably the greatest public health threat that we face in the US. When training on substance use disorders (SUDs), I describe it as a unique and complex issue in that it is like an octopus that has its tentacles wrapped up in every societal problem.
                  </contentabstract>
                 </p>
                 <p class="read-btn">
                  <a class="hard-shadow" href="/detailpage.aspx?pageid=1443&amp;id=15032387894">
                   Read More &gt;&gt;
                  </a>
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>

                <div class="block solid-5 round-all">
                 <p class="title">
                  A Further Look at Adult Children of Addiction
                 </p>
                 <div class="content solid-1 round-all">
                  <div class="hero ft-left">
                   <img src="/uploadedImages/Images/Articles/ci_nacoa.jpg?n=3723" width="140"/>
                  </div>
                  <p>
                   <contentabstract>
                    Resilient qualities are not only what we are born with, but also the strengths that we build through encountering life’s challenges and developing the personal and interpersonal skills to meet them. The idea of growth through suffering or pain is not a new one, though the systematic study of it is.
                   </contentabstract>
                  </p>

        <script type="text/javascript">
         var lblLoadingMessage = $('#ctl00_MyLogin1_lblLoadingMessage');
     var lblSignInMessage = $('#ctl00_MyLogin1_lblSignInMessage');
     var btnLogin = $('#ctl00_MyLogin1_btnLogin');
 
     function setLoadingMessage(msg) {
         lblLoadingMessage.html(msg);
     }
 
     function setSignInMessage(msg) {
         lblSignInMessage.html(msg);
     }
 
     function startSignIn() {
         setLoadingMessage('Please wait...');
         setSignInMessage('');
     }
        </script>
        <div id="ctl00_MyLogin1_upSignIn">
         <div class="f-left l-text" style="width: 300px;">
          <div if="pnlLogin">

            </strong>
           </p>

            </li>
           </ul>
           <p style="font-weight: bold">
            <span id="ctl00_MyLogin1_lblSignInMessage">
            </span>
           </p>

            <span id="ctl00_MyLogin1_lblLoadingMessage">
            </span>
           </p>
           <div class="r-text clearfix">
            <input class="round-all f6 solid-5 aspx-button" id="ctl00_MyLogin1_btnLogin" name="ctl00$MyLogin1$btnLogin" onclick="startSignIn();" style="border-style:None;" type="submit" value="Sign In"/>
           </div>

            <a href="/resetpassword.aspx">
